Command Line Utilites¶

Annotate BAM files¶

Annotate both mates of paired-end alignments

usage: annnotateBAM [-h] [-b BFILE] [-g GFILE] [-r RFILE] [-o OFILE]
Options:
-b BAM file(s). A single aligment file contains all paired-end mates, or a comma separated list of 2 files, one per each set of mates (useful when mate origin is important).
-g GTF file. Annotation file with biotype information
-r BED file. Annotation file with repeats information
-o=output STR. Name of output file. Default = “output”

Compute correlation between number of links and number of histone peaks¶

Computes correlation between number of aimer-target links and number of ChIP-seq/DNase peaks

usage: corrWind [-h] [-l LFILE] [-e EXON] [-w WINDOW] [-t LINKTYPE] [-d DIST]
                [-c CFILE] [-f FOLDER] [-o OFILE]
Options:
-l BED file. Paired-end alignment reads are presente on each line. Output of annotateBAM.py
-e STR BOOL. “True”, for checking that a mate should overlap and exon to be counted as outgoing link of a window (if both mates are on the same window, at least one of them should overlap an exon). “False”, if want to count all links.
-w INT. Window size (nt) when splitting genome.
-t STR. Link type: aware, blind.
-d INT. Distance between mates to be consider not selfligating.
-c TAB file. Chromosome size information
-f STR. Folder where the ChIP-seq/DNase peak files are stored
-o STR. Name of output file.

Count long range interactions¶

Counts the number of RNA and DNA mates per gene (including introns). Only mates where the RNA-ends overlap exons are use.

usage: countHits [-h] [-a AFILE] [-g GFILE] [-d DISTANCE] [-o OFILE]
Options:
-a BED file. Output of annotateBAM.py, where the left and right ends correspond to DNA and RNA, respectively
-g GTF file. Annotation file with biotype information
-d=2000 INT. Minimum distance (in nucleotides) between RNA-DNA ends to be considered as a long range interaccion. Default = 2000 b
-o STR. Name of output file.

Remove overlapps¶

Remove overlapping reads.

usage: removeOverlapps [-h] [-i IFILE] [-o OFILE]
Options:
-i BED file. Coordenate-sorted output of annotateBAM.py.
-o BED file. Name of output file. Same format as input file.

Filter out reads showing known splice-junctions¶

Get interesting read’s IDs (printed to STDOUT). That’s, reads that: (1) have spliced junctions concordant with the annotated genome, and (2) have a mate farther apart than a given distance

usage: sj [-h] [-b BFILE] [-d DIST] [-o OFILE]
Options:
-b BAM file(s). A single aligment file contains all paired-end mates.
-d INT. Minimum distance between paired-end mates
-o STR. Name of output file.

Compute specificity of blind-links¶

Computes fold change of blind-links on regions targeted by aware-lings vs blind-links targeting everywhere

usage: specificity [-h] [-a AFILE] [-b BFILE] [-e EXON] [-w WINDOW] [-d DIST]
                   [-c CFILE] [-o OFILE]
Options:
-a BED file. Aware-links file. The first and second mates correspond to DNA and RNA annotated using annotateBAM.py
-b BED file. Blind-links file. annotated using annotateBAM.py
-e STR BOOL. “True”, for checking that a mate should overlap and exon to be counted as outgoing link of a window (if both mates are on the same window, at least one of them should overlap an exon). “False”, if want to count all links.
-w INT. Window size (nt) when splitting genome.
-d INT. Distance between mates to be consider not selfligating.
-c TAB file. Chromosome size information
-o STR. Name of output file.
